title: Kaley Cuoco reveals The Big Bang Theory and Friends crossover photo
text:
We finally have the Friends and The Big Bang Theory crossover we all deserve, thanks to Kaley (Picture: Warner Bros./CBS)

Kaley Cuoco gave fans The Big Bang Theory fans a glimpse of the Friends crossover we all deserved, but will never have, as she managed to take a seat on the iconic orange sofa.

While Jennifer Aniston teased her old cast mates – David Schwimmer, Courteney Cox, Matthew Perry, Lisa Kudrow and Matt LeBlanc – are ‘working on something’ this week, she threw hopes of a reboot in the bin.

So, despite Kaley’s hopes for the two sitcoms one day colliding, she’ll have to keep dreaming.

However, the 33-year-old did manage to grab an umbrella and recreate the Friend opening title sequence, captioning her shot on Instagram: ‘With my partner in production crime @suemack8 takin it all in @hbo maxis and duh we found the Friends couch.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Unsurprisingly, the photo sent fans of the actress into a tailspin – even Monica star Courteney herself approving the snap.

‘The ultimate crossover!!’ cried one of the star’s 5.7 million followers, while another called for Kaley to land a spot in whatever Friends project is in the works, adding: ‘If there will ever be a friends reboot you’ll be one of the 3 girls for sure.’

Although, even if by some miracle we did manage to pop into Central Perk for one more coffee with Chandler, Monica, Rachel, Ross, Phoebe and Joey, Kaley’s got enough on her plate to keep her full for years.

As well as starring in HBO’s upcoming thriller The Flight Attendant, she’ll be serving as executive producer. And then there’s also fronting the new Harley Quinn series where she’ll be voicing the Batman villain which launches over the coming weeks.

No wonder, then, Kaley’s is now doing fine without The Big Bang Theory.

The Big Bang Theory and Friends are both available to stream on Netflix UK.
